text.sentence: Healthcare | U.S. Health Care Distribution and Technology seventeen February two thousand sixteen Stock Rating

Over the course of two thousand fifteen, Cerner's disappointing low single digit organic revenue growth rate has been offset by bookings growth of thirty two percent through the first nine months of the year, which pointed to a reacceleration of revenue in two thousand sixteen above and beyond management's guidance for thirteen percent y/y growth.

Dec Q bookings and oneQsixteen guidance are likely to undercut the expectation for upward revisions to initial two thousand sixteen guidance while adding new questions relative to the sustainable bookings growth rate.
This comes on top of lingering concerns regarding the rate of conversion between bookings and revenue.
We outline four tough questions Cerner must address at its annual investor meeting at HIMSS on three/two.
While high growth years have historically been followed by low growth years, it is unclear by how far the go forward bookings rate will trail the four year average of nineteen percent .
two) With the addition of HS, can CERN sustain double digit revenue growth?
The addition of Health Service's large revenue base will depress total company growth relative to pre two thousand fifteen levels.
In retrospect, the step up in oneH L T bookings was more significant than we appreciated but does not fully explain the weakening relationship between bookings and revenue recognition.
Cerner may be nearing peak contribution margin and after a year of integration benefits, expense reduction opportunities are likely more limited moving forward.
CERN possesses the most valuable franchise in the core HCIT vendor marketplace, having gained share via the Stimulus wave and through the acquisition of Siemens.
We expect that the company will leverage increased R and D investment to execute against a unique cross sell opportunity.

Nonetheless, we harbor concerns that core growth is decelerating and that cross sales from ambulatory, revenue cycle, and services will weigh on op margins, offsetting potential lift from software and population health.
Given these concerns, we are reducing the premium valuation we are willing to apply to CERN shares from twenty fivex to twenty onex.
Our new DCF based target price of dollar fifty five implies a target P/E multiple of twenty onex on our updated two thousand sixteen EPS estimate of dollar two.thirty two.

U.S. Health Care Distribution and Technology Industry View: POSITIVE Stock Rating: OVERWEIGHT two thousand fifteenA two thousand sixteenE two thousand seventeenE two thousand eighteenE four thousand four hundred twenty five five thousand twenty four five thousand five hundred thirty three N/A one thousand three hundred twenty two one thousand seven hundred forty three N/A N/A eight hundred seventy nine one thousand one hundred thirty two N/A N/A eight hundred four nine hundred seventy two one thousand one hundred thirteen N/A eight hundred nine nine hundred fifteen N/A seven hundred forty one two.eleven

CAGR N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A Average twenty three.eight
After several years of share gains, Cerner has a strong installed base and opportunities to increase revenue via greater capture of customers' total HCIT spending.
Management has shown the ability to continuously innovate and we expect Cerner's customers will look to the company to help them navigate the transition to increasingly valuebased reimbursement.
Cerner's newer solutions gain traction within its customer base faster than expected.
We see upside in the multiple to fifteenx two thousand sixteen adjusted EV/EBITDA, implying a stock valuation of dollar seventy five.
Failure to meet high bookings and revenue growth expectations as clients reduce spending post stimulus.
We see downside in the multiple to eightx two thousand sixteen adjusted EV/EBITDA, implying a stock valuation of dollar forty.

Despite Cerner's valuable franchise and tremendous cross sell opportunities, we harbor concerns that organic growth is slowing and mix is increasingly shifting toward lower margin products and services.
We believe the company will directly address the outlook for growth, contribution margin targets and expense leverage during the annual investor meeting at HIMSS on March twond.
Barring the bookings miss, fourQfifteen results were in line with our expectation.
hundred seventy five, in line with our and consensus estimates for the first time in four quarters.
Siemens HS contributed dollar two hundred forty fivemn of revenue, implying core revenue of dollar nine hundred thirtymn .
Gross margin expanded one hundred seventy one bps y/y to eighty three.
percent due to a larger mix of licensed software while operating margin of twenty four.seven
percent was flat as a result of continued expense management following the Siemens acquisition last February.
R and D tax credit related benefit, Cerner reported fourQ EPS of dollar .fifty
FYsixteen revenue guidance bracketed prior guidance while EPS guidance was unchanged.
The company expects two thousand sixteen revenue of dollar four.nine dollar five.bn, implying y/y growth of thirteen percent .
Assuming zero to slightly negative growth from the HS business, this implies a strong reacceleration of core Cerner revenue in FYsixteen from three percent in FYfifteen.
As a reminder, the company expects to maintain adjusted operating margins around twenty five percent in FYsixteen but further margin expansion
Barclays | Cerner Corp. following the HS integration will be limited due to anticipated increases in near term noncash expenses associated with depreciation and amortization.

As Cerner continues to expand off a larger base, we do not expect future bookings to continue the streak of strong growth rates seen in two thousand fifteen ; however, this quarter's shortfall illustrates the company's dependence on larger Works type deals to fuel future bookings growth.

We note oneQfifteen bookings represents a tough comp given thirty seven percent of the quarter's bookings included long term contracts, whereas Cerner's oneQsixteen expectations do not reflect any ITWorks or RevWorks deals.
While outsourcing/Works deals are not won via competitive processes, we note they are: one) lumpy, and two) convert more slowly from backlog to revenue compared to traditional license/software sales.

Management reiterated that two thousand sixteen revenue performance is not significantly contingent on new business wins as the current backlog provides visibility into seventy nine percent of FYsixteen revenues .
The company generated dollar three hundred fifty threemn of operating cash flow, up from dollar two hundred seventy twomn in the prior quarter.

Capital expenditures totalled dollar one hundred sevenmn and capitalized software was dollar sixtymn, resulting in FCF of dollar one hundred eighty sixmn, up nicely from dollar one hundred elevenmn in threeQ and dollar ninety ninemn in fourQfourteen.
We expect FCF to benefit from continued efforts to improve DSO going forward.
Cerner ended the quarter with dollar five hundred thirteenmn of total cash and investments.
We are reducing our price target to dollar fifty five from dollar fifty nine.
Our two thousand sixteen EPS estimate decreases to dollar two.thirty two, from dollar two.thirty five, to reflect lower FYsixteen bookings expectations.

Our DCF based dollar fifty five price target equates to a target EV/EBITDA multiple of elevenx our two thousand sixteen adjusted EBITDA estimate and a P/E target of twenty onex our two thousand sixteen EPS estimate of dollar two.thirty two.

Risk Disclosure Master limited partnerships are pass through entities structured as publicly listed partnerships.
For tax purposes, distributions to MLP unit holders may be treated as a return of principal.
Investors should consult their own tax advisors before investing in MLP units.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Below is the list of companies that constitute the industry coverage universe: U.S. Health Care Distribution and Technology Allscripts Healthcare Solutions, Inc. Cardinal Health Inc. Express Scripts Holding Co. Press Ganey Holdings Inc. Distribution of Ratings: Barclays Equity Research has one thousand eight hundred eighty three companies under coverage.

forty one percent have been assigned an Overweight rating which, for purposes of mandatory regulatory disclosures, is classified as a Buy rating; sixty one percent of companies with this rating are investment banking clients of the Firm.

forty percent have been assigned an Equal Weight rating which, for purposes of mandatory regulatory disclosures, is classified as a Hold rating; fifty percent of companies with this rating are investment banking clients of the Firm.

fifteen percent have been assigned an Underweight rating which, for purposes of mandatory regulatory disclosures, is classified as a Sell rating; forty four percent of companies with this rating are investment banking clients of the Firm.
Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts seventeen February two thousand sixteen seven AmerisourceBergen Corp. Cerner Corp. McKesson Corp.
may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .
To see a list of companies that comprise a particular industry coverage universe, please go to http://publicresearch.barclays

Source: Thomson Reuters, Barclays Research Historical stock prices and price targets may have been adjusted for stock splits and dividends.

CD: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a market maker in debt securities issued by Cerner Corp.. CE: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a market maker in equity securities issued by Cerner Corp.. J: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a liquidity provider and/or trades regularly in the securities by Cerner Corp. and/or in any related derivatives.
Valuation Methodology: Our dollar fifty five price target is derived from DCF analysis based on a discount rate of seven percent and a terminal growth rate of three percent .
This target price equates to a target EV/EBITDA multiple of elevenx our two thousand sixteen adjusted EBITDA estimate and a P/E target of twenty onex our two thousand sixteen EPS estimate.
Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target: one) High bookings growth expectations represent a near term risk for Cerner each quarter.
two) Failure to execute on the double digit top line growth presents a long term risk to our growth outlook.
three) The company faces increasing competition from new healthcare entrants and established non healthcare entrants.four)
Mismanagement of the Siemens installed base causes lower than expected customer retention and is a significant burden on costs and management attention
